The goal of the Risk Management (PSM/RM Program) is to reduce the risk to employees and the public of injury or death from accidental release of chemicals.  The organization?s management is committed to achieving this goal.

The purpose of the management program is to ensure that everyone who plays a part in the PSM/RM Program understands their roles and responsibilities and that responsibilities are assigned for all program elements.

The program establishes training guidelines to ensure that employees that work with highly hazardous chemicals receive initial and refresher training in accordance with OSHA Standard 1910.119 and that such training is documented.

The program complies with EPA Federal Regulation Part 68.150 through 68.190 and the Arizona Division of Occupational Safety and Health Standard CFR 29 1910.119 for Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals.

1.2    SCOPE

This procedure defines who has overall responsibility for the PSM/RM Program.  This procedure also defines who has been delegated responsibility for individual program elements as well as the lines of authority between those with program responsibilities.

1.3    OVERALL RESPONSIBILITY

The Risk Services Manager shall have overall responsibility for development, implementation and integration of the PSM/RM Program.  PSM/RMP Oversight Team - Assist in development and implementation of process safety and risk management plans Risk Management, Emergency Services, Water, CMR and Scottsdale Fire Department staff.  Process Hazard Analysis Include personnel from chlorine areas and water campus.  PHA Team members have completed analysis of all sites handling highly hazardous chemicals in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119    Selected water treatment plant operators, parks staff, Scottsdale Fire Department, Risk Management and Emergency Services.

Operating Procedures Operators will work with the plant superintendent to develop, review, and/or update operating procedures.

Training  Affected city

employees will be consulted during initial training as to content/frequency of training.  All affected employees will receive initial and refresher training on operating procedures.      All water campus operatorsApplicable Water Production staff, All Aquatics Techs.

Contractor Safety    Operators notified when contractors are on-site and advise supervisors if they observe breaches in plant safety rules.    All water campus operatorsApplicable Water Production staff, All  Aquatics Techs.

Prestartup Safety Reviews    Include plant operators and maintenance personnel in prestartup safety reviews.    Selected operators and maintenance personnel.

Mechanical Integrity    Maintenance personnel will assist supervisor in developing and reviewing maintenance procedures and preventative maintenance schedules.    Selected maintenance staff

Hot Work Permits    Maintenance personnel will implement hot work permit program.  Operators notified of hot work activities.    All city staff doing hot work.

Incident Investigation    City staff will cooperate with investigation team and selected staff may participate in the investigation    All affected city staff.

Emergency Planning and Response

Participate in annual emergency preparedness drills with RMFD.  All affected city staff shall be given training in their site-specific emergency plans.    All Water Campus employeesAll pool facility employees

Management of Change

City of Scottsdale management of change forms shall be used to alert supervisors of potential changes.

Emergency Preparedness Drills with Fire Department are required to be conducted at least annually.
